body:
You added a link to a Zulip discussion, please make sure the description of the issue is comprehensive and doesn't require accessing Zulip

<sub>This message is automatically generated by a bot.</sub>
My understanding is that `QuarkusIntegrationTest` were run in prod mode. I'm not entirely sure why the behavior changed though. Maybe @radcortez has a clue?
I'll have a look, but yes, `QuarkusIntegrationTest` runs in prod mode.

The issue here is that `quarkus.test.integration-test-profile` is not being propagated to the Gradle Test task. It may have worked before by chance, and most likely, https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/42715 "fixed it".

Alternatively, you can use `export QUARKUS_TEST_INTEGRATION_TEST_PROFILE=test`, or set `quarkus.test.integration-test-profile` directly in `application.properties`. It is only used for tests, so while inconvenient, it should be harmless to have it there when running in `prod`.

Now for a fix, I'm unsure what would be the best option. Probably calling `org.gradle.api.tasks.testing.Test#setSystemProperties` when registering the task?

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/e39915fda7d23eb861c310f30d9e94ead52eecf1/devtools/gradle/gradle-application-plugin/src/main/java/io/quarkus/gradle/QuarkusPlugin.java#L424-L430

In other places, we propagate `quarkus` configuration by querying the `Config`, which also includes defaults, which we probably don't need here. I'm wondering if only `quarkus` configurations from System Properties would be the right approach?

//cc @snazy

> The issue here is that `quarkus.test.integration-test-profile` is not being propagated to the Gradle Test task. It may have worked before by chance, and most likely, [#42715](https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/42715) "fixed it".
> 
> Alternatively, you can use `export QUARKUS_TEST_INTEGRATION_TEST_PROFILE=test`, or set `quarkus.test.integration-test-profile` directly in `application.properties`. It is only used for tests, so while inconvenient, it should be harmless to have it there when running in `prod`.

Hello @radcortez. Thank you for response. 

So let's say I'd like to use `quarkus.test.integration-test-profile` in application.properties. 
Should it be then set like this `quarkus.test.integration-test-profile=test`? 
Asking because I've tested it with `=test` but it didn't change anything, still the same issue.
Sorry, you also need to include `quarkus.test.native-image-profile=test`

issue.title: Pass system properties to Gradle test tasks

labels.name: area/devtools
labels.description: Issues/PR related to maven, gradle, platform and cli tooling/plugins
